prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Next, create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1) with the following loops: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] + Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.375, 0.75] + Line 4: Start Point [0.375, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] + Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Once the 2D sketch is complete, scale it by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a distance of 0.375 units to create the 3D model. This will result in a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom, with a length of approximately 0.75 units, a width of approximately 0.375 units, and a height of approximately 0.75 units. **Part 2 (if applicable)** (Instructions for Part 2 will be provided here, if applicable.) **Part 3 (if applicable)** (Instructions for Part 3 will be provided here, if applicable.) Note: The final shape of the CAD model will be a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom, as determined by the VLM model. The length, width, and height of each intermediate CAD part and the final shape are provided as references. The instructions provided here are specific to the given "CAD Assembly JSON" and do not include any additional assumptions.</description>

The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. Dimensions: 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Construct a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.375, 0.0 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with the following vertices: - Vertex 1: 0.0, 0.0 - Vertex 2: 0.75, 0.0 - Vertex 3: 0.75, 0.25 - Vertex 4: 0.0, 0.25 4. Close the loop to create a rectangular face. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the parameters from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.375 units in the positive direction of the Z-axis. **<part\\_2>:** Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The side is angled at 45 degrees from the top and bottom. Dimensions: 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. 1. Construct a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.5, 0.0, 0.125 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with the following vertices: - Vertex 1: 0.0, 0.0 - Vertex 2: 0.125, 0.0 - Vertex 3: 0.125, 0.125 - Vertex 4: 0.0, 0.125 4. Close the loop to create a rectangular face. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.375 units in the negative direction of the Z-axis. 6. Subtract the created prism from the previous one to create a tapered section in between them. Note: The original design description has a slightly tapered middle section. Therefore, we create part\\_2 with an extrusion depth of 0.375 units in the negative direction of the Z-axis and subtract it from the previous body. This effectively creates a tapered section in between the two parts, without altering the dimensions of part\\_1. The provided instructions construct the final shape with a single rectangular opening on one of its faces, as described in the original design intend. The opening is obtained by subtracting part\\_2 from part\\_1 during the booleans operation, resulting in the tapered section of the final shape while preserving the original dimensions of part\\_1.</description>
